    Prove that if mmm and nnn are coprime then the group Cm×CnC_{m} \times C_{n}Cm​×Cn​ is cyclic.

    If mmm and nnn are not coprime, can it happen that Cm×CnC_{m} \times C_{n}Cm​×Cn​ is cyclic?

    [Here CnC_{n}Cn​ denotes the cyclic group of order nnn.]

    Algebra and Geometry
    Part IA, 2007

    What does it mean to say that a subgroup HHH of a group GGG is normal? Give, with justification, an example of a subgroup of a group that is normal, and also an example of a subgroup of a group that is not normal.

    If HHH is a normal subgroup of GGG, explain carefully how to make the set of (left) cosets of HHH into a group.

    Let HHH be a normal subgroup of a finite group GGG. Which of the following are always true, and which can be false? Give proofs or counterexamples as appropriate.

    (i) If GGG is cyclic then HHH and G/HG / HG/H are cyclic.

    (ii) If HHH and G/HG / HG/H are cyclic then GGG is cyclic.

    (iii) If GGG is abelian then HHH and G/HG / HG/H are abelian.

    (iv) If HHH and G/HG / HG/H are abelian then GGG is abelian.
